text: Has anyone been using, or know if the HubSpot Knowledge Base can be setup to be used as a 'closed' knowledge base for internal staff?
For the report builder, is there a reason why (as an admin on the portal) I dont have access to build a custom report using the events data type?
Also who is the person to reach for issues with the custom report builder at HS?

<@U2H3TT8F2> I’m assuming this is an Enterprise Account that has access to Events?  Any other types of reports you aren’t able to build out?  As for who to reach out to, Support is going to be your best
looks like they are pro and dont get access to event reporting
other than that, it looks like activites dont load geneall activities like email opens and such, is that part of events?

No, Events is something specific to Enterprise portals.  Common examples are things app logins, video watches for button clicks (that aren’t CTAs). The reason they can’t report on them is they don’t access them at all. Activities is for sales activities, like calls and emails. Marketing email opens and Clicks still need to be reported on from the Email tool, rather than the dashboard
HubSpot Newbie ... can i add HubL hooks inside of HTML? For example, if i want to add a blog post title {{ content.name }} to a header, can I do that inside of wrapping HTML?
you still need HTML structure, HubL (for the most part) does not generate HTML so if you need that post title to be the H1 for example `<h1>{{content.name}}</h1>`
to clarify in-case I answered the wrong question. in .html, .css, .js files and drag n drop templates you can use HubL

thanks <@U7SL518D6> for answering! Does the spacing matter? Also, can i put this anywhere? For example, I want to add it to the header, I can just drag n drop a HTML  and add the code <h1> {{content.name}}</h1>, correct?
not 100% sure I’m following what you’re meaning to ask. but yes you can put that html and HubL in the header and it will work.
ok ... i'll give it a try. thanks again <@U7SL518D6>
